derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from Latin sessilis, from sess- 'seated', from the verb sedere

means.word_mean: 1. permanently attached to a substrate; not free to move about;
2. attached directly by the base; not having an intervening stalk;

sentences.sentence: "the shell of a sessile barnacle is attached directly to a substrate"
